isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - FRONT DRIVE AXLE: SPICER S-9000 - DIFFERENTIAL DISASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL DISASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Use Figure 3 as a reference to disassemble the differential.

step1.para: Match mark differential case halves with punch or chisel for correct alignment in reassembly ( Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Match Mark For Correct Reassembly

step1.para: Remove differential case bolts and self-locking nuts and lift off the right hand case half.
Remove thrust washer and differential side gear ( Figure 9).
Lift out cross shaft, differential pinions and thrust washers ( Figure 10).
Remove second differential side gear and thrust washer ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Remove Second Side Gear and Washer

note.para: Inspect all parts, including the machined surfaces of the case itself.
If any gears are to be replaced, they must be replaced in sets. Inspect thrust washers for scoring and excessive wear. Replace all worn or damaged parts.

step1.para: When it is necessary to remove ring gear from differential case, carefully center punch each rivet head. Use 15/32 inch drill bit to drill through rivet heads to depth as shown ( Figure 12). Next, use a rounded type punch to drive out remaining portion of the rivet.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Use Rounded Punch to Drive Out Rivet

note.para: Do not use a chisel to remove rivet heads ( Figure 12), as damage to differential case may result. Always use a soft metal hammer or H.D. plastic head to strike punch.

step1.para: When reinstalling ring gear to differential case, use hydraulic or mechanical press and riveting fixture, such as special tool #ZTSE2222. Pressure requirement per rivet is 20 - 25 U.S. tons or 18.1 - 22.7 metric tons.
If differential side bearings are to be replaced, remove old bearings using suitable puller.
